review: Okay, Red Robin... I am really really excited that they offer a VEGAN patty! However their veggie burger is advertised toward vegetarians, and if I hadn't looked online in advance, I wouldn't have known that the normal sesame bun isn't vegan (go for the ciabatta or lettuce wrap instead).  I went to Red Robin for the first time in the last several years last night, so I'm not sure if this review is a true depiction of the day to day. We waited about 10 minutes to even be put on the waiting list, as the hostess was busy. No problem- she was super apologetic and friendly, and we were seated within 5 minutes. My son (who is beyond picky) actually ate 3 bites of his veggie burger, and I devoured mine immediately. My partner had a meat burger which he liked. My fruit salad was pretty much just fruit cocktail from a can. The french fries were tasty though.  My biggest complaint was oddly the bathrooms. Toilet was overflowing and their was toilet paper strewn everywhere! Gross!  All in all I'm thankful for another vegan option and the service was decent. It's kind of a toss up if I'll be back again.

Horrible experience. They couldn't get the bill correct. The waitress kept giving everyone attitude and the managers were non existent ! The bread on my burger was hard and the bread on my other burger was soggy. You can tell the burgers had been under a heat lamp forever.  Correction : Manager just came to talk To us ( unexpectedly) and proceeded to defend the horrible customer service !  This is one of the reasons people stay away from the mall !

Honestly, I love Red Robin, but, the past two times I have gone to this location i have been very disappointed.         The first mess up was when i found a little bug in my alcoholic drink. It was just the floating in my cocktail. I alerted my waiter and he apologized and brought me a new one. It was all fine until towards the end of the drink and boom another one. I was disgusted and just wanted to leave. We got our bill and he charged me for the first drink that i didn't even take a sip of!      I didn't go back until a few months later...I decided to give it another go. Well i get my BBQ chicken wrap and there is a dark thick hair just sitting on top of the wrap. I mentioned this to my friends and family and they also have had similar experiences. It really sucks because it used to be my favorite place. They really need to step their game up or the Health Department needs to intervene at this point. It's not about being picky or snotty, it's about public health and sanitation. This is how germs and diseases spread people!

Came in Sunday to watch football with my husband and it was super crowded,  I guess people are starting their Christmas shopping.... We found 2 seats at the bar and Amyee was our bartender. It was busy and she was a lone ranger pretty much, but she kept her cool, was on top of our drinks and food, she changed the channel to our football game and was just an A+ all around Customer Service employee. If you are looking for quick service with a smile, see if Amyee is working the bar area and find a seat, you will be happy you took my advice!!
The service was excellent however it really took a long time to get sat down and get our food.  I loved their sweet potato fries. The cut, the crispiness and the portion was  perfect.

I really dig this place. I will preclude this by saying that I have only sat at the bar here. I get the most wonderful and fast service when I do so why else would I sit elsewhere?  The food is always good. I usually get the Pig Out style Double Tavern and it is just as delicious as the first one I got. My gf usually gets something new each time and she never has any complaints of how the food has been cooked or assembled but sometimes she might not like the choice she made that day.  Bottomless fries! Who doesn't like bottomless fries and a good ranch sauce? This is a major factor in why I choose this place. Who else offers this? I sure would like to know so I can visit them as well.  Overall, it may not be the best quality food because it is a chain restaurant but I have never had a bad experience with the food, service or anything for that matter. It is definitely my go to in Bakersfield when I am around the mall area. Plus they have a decent craft beer selection.

I'm not sure what I expected here, but it did not live up to what I was hoping for. Our waiter was nice, but this is one of those restaurants with a Ziosk. I feel that any restaurant I've been to recently with a Ziosk means that they expect their waiters to attend to more tables than what they would have otherwise. Maybe this is good overall, but I feel that we weren't checked on nearly enough (NOTE: I am not blaming the waiter/server, the waitstaff just does what they're instructed to do in a place like this.)  With that part mentioned, I should speak about what we really care about: food and drinks. Red Robin has lots of beers available to serve. They have a bar area as well. I am pretty sure that they have a full bar (I don't drink, so I am not 100% on this.) They also seem to serve craft beers based on the menus I did see. My children and wife are a fan of their "freckled lemonade," which is strawberry lemonade with real strawberries in the drink. You can get it with regular Minute Maid Lemonade or the same brand's Light Lemonade. My kids ordered from the children's menu. One ordered a grilled chicken breast served on sticks with a side of broccoli. She usually eats broccoli, she spit this one out. She did enjoy the grilled chicken breast on sticks. She's two and though that was very cool. Kid #2 ordered a grilled cheese sandwich with a side of mandarin oranges. She's not a big eater, so I don't think the sandwich was the problem, but she took only a few bites of it and thought that was enough. She devoured the oranges. I ordered from their classic burger menu and ordered their burger with a fried egg and two strips of bacon on it (I don't recall its name.) I liked my burger, but I thought it was odd that I was never asked how I wanted my burger. I guess the only option is well done at this restaurant, because that is what my wife and I both received with our meals. My burger was alright and my fries were about the same, but they weren't so alright that I will be rushing back here. The wife ordered from their specialty burgers. I believe it was called the Mad Love burger. It looked delicious on the menu, but her burger was beyond well done and was actually split in half before it was served to her. She said that the burger was so overwhelmingly charred that she couldn't even taste the loads of other toppings. I sampled the jalapeno relish that came with her burger and that tasted amazing.  We ordered fries with both burgers. I thought that they did bottomless fries here, but we were never once asked if we wanted another serving. I'm not sure why. The fries that came with our order were lukewarm and stale. They required lots of ketchup to make them edible. Normally, I love the steak fries here.  All in all, it wasn't a horrible experience, but the experience won't be making us rush back any time soon. And if it wasn't obvious, I don't care for those Ziosks.
Great burgers and friendly staff!! Good place to have a beer and a burger. No stress over anything, come in sit back and enjoy. Noise level is average and even the bar is a good spot to hang out.

Did an online order today. Order was completed accurately. Unfortunately I ordered a duplicate salad. Bummer for me.  This place was a mad house. The wait staff seemed to handle the crowd with little issue. I'm very glad I didn't ask to take a table. Whole lot of people.  Food tastes like I've come to expect from Red Robin. I ordered the whiskey river BBQ salad. It had fresh veggies and the dressing complimented it well. Wish it had come with a little more. Next time I will ask. Two Avo-Cobb-o salads an

Short husky bartender with a beard should not be paid to do anything with customer interactions! The computer system was down and everyone was backed up. He was snapping at customers, coworkers, slamming things, throwing things, and cussing like no other. I didn't order food after ordering my drink because I was scared to upset him more.  Avoid establishments that employ a$$holes like this guy!

This is one of my son's favorite spots, well actually we all like it. I like to buy gift cards from here to give to my son every now and then, and their gift cards are always so cute. They have a variety of burgers and sandwiches and different flavored dips to go on either fries or burgers. You can pretty much add anything to your burger/sandwich to your liking, like bacon, egg, blue cheese etc. I've actually never had anything taste bad from here. The food, drinks, and alcoholic drinks are good. It's nice to have a sit-down eatery in the mall that doesn't make you feel like you're still in the sometimes crowded mall.

Wow.  I had such a great experience here. First of all, the host Jaqueline was quick to attend us. After we were seated, the bartender Nathan was SO helpful and honestly did a better job than any waiter. The manager Kim kept a steady conversation with us while we enjoyed our fresh onion rings and fries.  Overall, GREAT staff!  Would love to come back.

I love Red Robin. This location is horrible. Stay away.  I arrived at 11am and was made to wait for 15 minutes for a table at an almost empty restaurant.  They showed me to my table and the room it was in had food all over the floor and the table had bits of food and crumbs from other mouths all over it. Again, it was 11 am, so nobody had sat there yet for the day. But the table and the whole restaurant was filthy.  I asked for the manager. She placed blame on a "contract cleaning crew" who didn't do their job right and then put me at another table. But I watched and they didn't clean the table or the floor and just sat someone else there a few minutes later.  When my appetizers arrived the plates they gave me were filthy. Chunks of food and sauces stuck to them. I again called for the manager. Their solution was to bring me new plates. After the appetizers were cleared from the table they got back to me with cleaner plates.  My burger was different from every other Red Robin I have ever been to. Small and with meager toppings. They gave me 11 french fries with it. Corporate needs to shut this place down yesterday.
Red Robin so hard to decide, I want every burger.  . I love this place. Waiters are all friendly. I really like the bar area, always a fun time. Only complaint is the bathroom was not clean..

I waited 45 minutes yesterday for my simple burger which wasn't even done correctly. I ordered fruit and broccoli on the side. The fruit was very mushy and looked gross. By the time I was done eating my broccoli in a bowl, I noticed there was a dead roach in the bowl. The manager came out to apologize and gave a lame excuse as to why there was a roach in my food. I am done coming here. Too gross and not a clean environment. I'd rather eat somewhere and not have to worry about roaches hidden in my food

Recently went Vegan & Red Robin made it easy for me to know my options! In the menu there a section that suggests for Vegetarians & Vegans, you can order ANY burger, replace the meat with a Boca burger & add toppings or take off cheese. I love this place & even with my new dietary changes, it's still a firm option for delicious food!!!

I like Red Robin. I haven't been here in a while, like the update to restaurant and bar area. Service wasn't as good as it used it be, server was always busy talking with other servers. Food was good but had a lot of extra little pieces and crumbs of other foods that didn't belong with what I ordered. Plates are plastic and all scratched up. Makes them look dirty. I'll keep going to Chili's instead

Came in to get my free birthday burger and sat in the bar area (no kids). Ordered the voodoo fries off the appetizer menu. The menu says it comes with your choice of ranch or ghost pepper sauce, yet I was charged Extra for the ghost pepper sauce. Hit the "call server" button on the kiosk and was ignored by absolutely every server that came by. It was like the damn twilight zone. The server came by once after we got our food, but was in a rush as he did it, so it felt like a fly by. The service tonight was incredibly poor considering how dead it was in there. Not sure I'd bother coming back at all.

There's nothing like having to move your family to a different booth because grown adults can't conduct themselves respectfully in public. What a disappointment! This has no reflection on the restaurant management and employees. However, unfortunately, it does affect the way I feel about patronizing this establishment.  We have been to several Red Robins throughout California because our boys love it and this location has been the biggest disappointment. Each time we have come it has not been the best experience.  Tonight, however, was different. We had an amazing waitress that catered to our every need. My husband was impressed with the fact that she brought both of us ranch dressing on our plates for our fries. We didn't have to ask for it. The food was good, but I was so disappointed in the fries. I love their fries, but mine were old and cold.  Tonight gave us hope for future ventures here, but I'm not sure how soon will be going back.
Red Robin YUM!! Its our go to place when we want to sit and eat good food! Plus big big beers! YES!!!

Although the food has a good taste when it comes to service , there's a lot to be desired. I went to this Red Robin for lunch , my order was correct , my friends order was semi correct , and the order for her daughter was never brought , and still appeared on the bill until it was mentioned. The wait for the food was 7-8 minutes , yet we received our orders 23 minutes later and COLD.

Yes, every now and then I'm a sucker for a good burger. I know Red Robin is a chain restaurant, but something about those garlic fries that makes me want to come back all the time. If I had to choose where my favorite fries were from, then with no hesitation Red Robin would be in my top 5 to choose from. They have bottomless garlic fries and I always end up hardly touching my burger because of that. When my family and I are trying to figure out dinner and we all crave burgers, this is definitely one of the spots that is picked. Love the burger options here as their is a burger for everyone. The atmosphere is nice and the workers are always great. The good thing is, even though Red Robin is always busy, it doesn't take long to get seated. I don't think I've ever had to wait longer than 15min to get seated. Amazingly, I don't think I've ever browsed their desserts as I'm a sucker for sweets. I'm always too full from stuffing my face w those amazing garlic fries.

We called before showing up and we're told there was no wait. We show up and waited 1hr for a table of six. We were starving!!!!  The food is always great, but I will never come here with a group that's bigger than 4.

The service we had was terrible, Tori was the waitress, dismissive, walk around looking lost and not wanting to do anything. She left our food sitting for so long, when we finally received it, it was cold and had to be returned. Manager was helpful and tried to resolve the problem

If it wasn't for the free burger I earned a year ago that was about to expire I probably wouldn't have ventured here but this girl loves a good deal. It also happened to be Happy Hour so that made it even more enticing. We ordered two strawberry lemonades, spinach artichoke dip and a burger and fries. Even with the free burger and half off appetizer it was still $14.00 I found that kind of odd. The drinks were $5 each.... I feel like that is a LOT for lemonade with 4 soggy strawberries thrown in. All of it was pretty gross. Its a chain restaurant that seems like it has given up on itself.  Red Robin- Don't brag about bottomless fries and then give me 4 cold old fries on my plate and make me wait 20 minutes for another batch of 5 cold stale old fries. Just don't do it. Redeeming factor: sauces!! I love to dip! RR has so many good sauces. My one star is strongly dedicated to the campfire sauce, lemon poppy seed honey mustard and sweet and spicy ketchup

Food is yummy! My kids and I enjoy coming here to have a great burger. I have a lot of wonderful memories as a kid here myself, so it's nice to build memories with my kids. I didn't give a 5 star because the service is inconsistent, sometimes we have a wonderful server and it really makes for a fantastic experience, but however there are times were we have had horrible service and it makes me not want to return. Thank you to the good servers and management please get rid of the bad employees that are bringing this great place down. Please:)
The server was horrible but the manager Melissa made it well my burger was cold and she got me another one within minutes

Food was alright, service was subpar.  We were given utensils with some residue and what look like food chunks still stuck on them... it was pretty gross. On top of that, they took forever to stock the men's bathroom with tissue. We had to prompt the waiter twice about it and even then it still took a while to restock it. I understand dinner can be a hectic time, but those two things shouldn't suffer because of it.  The burgers we ordered were good. I mean, not super yummy gourmet burgers, but not fast food either so a good in between, teetering slightly on a lower quality since it is a chain restaurant. On the plus side, the burgers came with unlimited steak fries.

If I could give this place zero starts I would. Horrible service ! I had to wave down employees to get someone's attention and even then I got ignored ! The manager himself was hanging out chatting with his employees and just ignored me. Will not be coming back ever.  Worse service ever and they where not busy at all.

Came here looking for an afternoon snack. Ordered the Red Robin Chili Queso and Chips. $7. I received a plate roughly 6" by 12" rectangular, on it some chips, and a small square dish. The queso dish was 2.5" square and 1" deep. It was filled nearly half way.  Three chips later I'm now out of cheese and irritated. I would have expected more from Del Taco $0.99 nachos. At $7 I feel violated, and not in a good way.

I had the flu and in desperate need of some soup. The few places around valley plaza mall that serve soup, no longer serve it. Red Robin was my only remaining choice. I ordered a "bowl" of the chicken tortilla soup to go. This was an extremely small amount of soup that cost me close to $6. It was not soupy at all! It was beyond thick I felt like I was eating cheese and sour cream. The pieces of chicken were so chewy and disgusting. I won't ever go there again. I was Unsatisfied and contemplated calling to get a refund. I know $6 isn't a lot of money, but would you throw $6 in a trash can? Probably not. Paying for the soup was the equivalent of that.

This was the first time eating here... we hung out in the bar while we waited for a large table for our friends birthday. The bartender was awesome, and had great customer service. I was kinda disappointed as they couldn't make an old-fashion (not the bartenders fault), they didn't stock the bitters. We ordered the tower of onion rings, they came out quickly and were good. I would have preferred beer-batter instead of panko, but they didn't list beer batter as an option. My girlfriend and I split the royal robin burger which came with a fried egg and bacon. Overall the burger was average, they went a little heavy on the mayo/spread. The meat was average, a little passed medium (I had ordered medium rare), bacon was cooked perfectly and was very crispy. Also the egg was cooked just how we asked. However, the bun was horrible as it seemed like the cheap buns from a grocery store. It's good they didn't cook the burger medium rare, because with the buns they used it would have fallen apart. The only other complaint was the fries seemed old, as if they had been sitting in a bowl past 10 min waiting to be plated. Our server was Chrissy, and she did a wonderful job. Very attentive but not over the top... she was organized in splitting the checks ahead of time, and multitasked very well. This all added up to excellent customer service. Food got the three stars, customer service was 4.5. Overall decent food for pretty cheap prices.

Bottomless fries? Why yes, and Thank You! The unfortunate part of this all was that the service was mediocre. What ever happened to good customer service? I noticed another table had to ask for napkins multiple times before they got any. My future wife's salad looked good and tasted good from what I was told. Main reason we came here was because of shopping and a year old gift card. Well the gift card is gone and I don't know if and when we will return. Sorry!
I was here for the first time yesterday and honestly I see myself coming back here very soon. The service was great and the burgers were mouthwatering. Highly recommend the pig out double burger

It had been a long time since we had been to Red Robin. The burgers are very good. Endless fries. All in all a great experience. It's not my favorite place for burgers but everyone has their own preference.
Hadn't been here in a while. My wife's first time. Great service and I love that you can pay right there at your table. We all had burgers and the endless fries were fresh. Will come back for sure.

Came here to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday a day early, mainly cause he wanted the bottomless steak fries. We went on New Year's Day at around 4, and with the two of us, the young woman told us it would be a 10-15 minute wait. We were seated in less than ten minutes. We looked at our menus for a good minute before our waitress (Kaitlyn H.) swung by and asked what we wanted to drink. To be honest, she didn't introduce her name to us, I had to figure out what her name was by looking at my reciept at the end of the visit. Anyway, we didn't have time to think about what we wanted to drink, so we basically said the first thing in our heads: a water and coke. She came back with them very quickly. A good 5 minutes later, she came back and took our orders. We got a California Chicken Sandwich and a Burnin' Love (chicken substitute). We also got the $7 Spinach Artichoke dip for an appetizer  The dip came out quick, but it was a small portion, despite being $7. The dip was good, but there was barely any chip, and most of them were either too oily or just raw tortilla. The rest of the food came in after we finished the appetizer. Boy, did I smell all the spiciness from the Burnin' Love! With my CA Chicken, I can barely see or taste any of the guac that was in there.  My boyfriend and I finished our steak fries in a quick moment, and we wanted more! Everytime we tried ti wave down our waitress (Kaitlyn), she wouldn't see it/ignore it or ask us for a refill on our drinks and then quickly scuttle away before we can say anything else. Whenever we would try say thank you when she gave us something or took something, she would walk away before hearing us say thank you or listen for anything else. After FOREVER, she came by and asked if we wanted more fries. Duh. She came back hella quick with our fries, but we were already full to enjoy our fries. She walked away before I can ask for a box. I pressed the "call server" button, but its like she never acknowledged it. It took about 10 minutes until another server passed by and asked what we needed, and by the time that server came back with the box, Kaitlyn dropped by to see what was up a little too late.  TL;DR: Food was good, server was meh, and I didn't get to enjoy as much steak fries as I had hoped.

As they are one of the few restaurants open past 9 PM, I go there a few times a month.  I usually get the teriyaki burger which I find pretty good. Very messy but a lot of flavor.  The steak fries are five star. The last couple of times I tried something different.  The fish and chips were not good at all. I'm not sure if it was cooking or quality of fish, but two of the pieces were so solid you couldn't flake the fish apart when tried to bite.  The next time I tried the chicken tortilla soup. Mediocre at best. Tasted more like a generic canned soup them something made fresh. More thick and gooey than a flavorful broth. My dining partner ordered his burger with a Boca Patty on both occasions. The first time it was still ice cold in the center. We sent it back and came out fresh and hot.  The next time it was warm but not hot, as we had a movie time to meet he dealt with it.  I do applaud them for having a vegetarian option and I'm sure they need to keep those frozen before cooking.  But a quick refresher to the cooks on grilling/microwave time would be good ;)

Ok everyone, I'm going to share MY personal experience with Red Robin. If you chose to eat there, make sure you pray for your food. On 12/14/15 I took my grandson for his birthday to eat there along with my son and my niece. Me, my son and my grandson all had burgers, my niece had a chicken salad. Within 2 hours all of us who had burgers got sick to our stomaches with severe cramps and diarrhea. Not to mention I only ate 1/2 the burger, brought the other 1/2 home, that Nagi ate the next day (Tuesday) and he woke up with the next morning (Wednesday) with the same symptoms. The boys refused to go to the dr. My symptoms just worsened causing me to miss 2 1/2 days of work and a trip to urgent care.  I was just called from Sendas urgent Care and told my results came back positive for SALMONELLA (Food Contamination)!!  I say eat at your own risk there BUT as for me I will never eat there again!

We arrived at 9:30pm after watching a movie, when they close at 10:00pm. We ordered two bacon cheeseburgers. They were good! I would say over-priced, but I do like the idea of bottomless fries! I would ask for a toasted bun!  Now, the service we received and the restaurant environment: No one acknowledged us when we walked in; we had to wave down an employee. Though, after we were seated, the waitress and bus boy attended us quite well. Fun experience! I enjoyed the chalk boards for table entertainment. I will return again, but maybe not so close to closing time :)

Been a while since I've been to Red Robin, and I have to say that their food has gotten better. Wide range of burgers, and sandwiches yo choose from, and they all have good flavor. I would have given 5 stars, but the only reason I gave four stars was because they gave us our appetizers the same time we got our meals. The management apologized, and taken the apps off our bill. The Voodoo fries, and cheese curds are good...I recommend. The ghost pepper sauce is good, and perfect on the fiery burger I bought. I'll be back, but I hope the management can get the staff to be more attentive to the customer, and make sure the customers are taken care of...

i give this place zero, zero, minus zero stars. i ordered an avacado cob salad, worst, tasteless salad ever, fake blue cheese, not a whole avocado but only two very tiny chunks of avocado. not a whole tomato but only a few small little very tiny pieces of tomato. not a whole egg but only a few very tiny pieces of egg. a bed of mixed greens? no, all i got was nothing but old, cheap quality ice burg lettuce, and only the white end parts of the old low quality iceburg lettuce. iceburg lettuce has no nutritional value. the bacon was low quality and tasteless. the chicken was low quality and tasteless. it was the worst, low quality, tasteless salad i haver had.  i ordered the wedge burger. that hamburger patty was dry, tasteless low quality meat.  this not the first time i have had very low quality food here. the food here has hit bottom quality in the last five years. even the silverware is low quality. shut this place down. minus zero stars.

worse worst service ever they got my burger wrong twice all I wanted to do is eat a burger not sure why it's so hard when you order food this is my second time coming around Robin and will be my last time coming around Robin every time I've come for the last two times my order has been wrong and I've had to send my burger back

First and last time we will come to this place.. upon checking in "waiting time" for party 7 was 20min which was not bad so we waited and waited --- 45min later after us inquiring on the delay and seeing another party large party that arrived after us was seated before us --finally get called and get seated at a table that only seated 5! I looked at the waitress and ask her if she was planning on seating us separate and she looks at me and says please wait let me see what I can do I reply back no need and walk out! Upset and hungry! So disappointed
David did a great Job. He was very friendly and attentive to our needs . The food was great. I ordered the chophouse burger, it was delicious as always. Keep it up guys.

What can I say?  It's Red Robin.  You want a GOOD burger?  A specialty burger with stuff on it you won't find elsewhere?  At a reasonable price?  Here's your place.  I usually get the Burnin' Love Burger, with the fried jalapeno medallions.  But any burger that has the sweet pepper relish on it is also a great choice if you like a lot of flavor.   We like the onion rings, and the artichoke dip when we're in the mood for appetizers.  If we get an appetizer, I get one extra order of the bottomless fries, and take the burger home. Spotless,...always.  Good service, even if you sit in the bar,...always.   I had the jalapeno margarita the other day, and it was great.  Not for those who don't like hot stuff though. Join their club, and get good email specials on a regular basis.  Just don't forget to tip your waitress on the full amount that the check WOULD HAVE been, without the discount.  She has to work just as hard as if you paid full price.  I'm surprised at how many people don't know this.
Went back today for a bonsai burger Fast device in the bar area and friendly waiter I will definitely go again but burgers on pricey $14 the blue cheese mushroom burger 10 for the bonsai burger

Usually not my first choice of a dinner spot but me and the whole family came tonight and it was great! Our waiter David was awesome super friendly guy that helped us with everything we needed even before we needed to ask he is the definition of what a good server should be!! Both me and my husband and our daughters loved our dinner we had burgers and they were cooked just how we like them. I am stuffed..had a great dinner with my family and will now be back! Thanks Red Robin for a great experience for me and my family!!

Was it the 19 year old outside cursing more in a sentence than I do in a year? Was it the bribery to make us feel special to receive fries before our meal, right after the table next to us receives the same? Was it the lettuce wrap sandwich that made me feel like I was eating a bbq iceberg lettuce? Was it the self checkout which we couldn't self checkout because they were on misplaced tables? The waitress gave great effort, given her unfortunate environment, providing gracious refills and fries and a positive outlook on our split check request. Whatever it was, Red Robin Bakersfield delivers as you may expect, and as much as I sympathize for chain restaurants facing culinary yelp reviewing snobs, this experience cannot exceed three stars.
How can you be a burger spot but not be able to make any due to a broken grill. A worker says it has been happening every Sunday.  WTH  that is out of control. Fix it or buy new.

Sat at the Bar, the bartender was very nice greeted us and gave us a menu, took our drink orders.  Had a Blue Moon and Sam Adams October fest, booth so good with the Whiskey BBQ burger and fish and chips. Both new things I haven't tried finished both. The company at the bar was interesting everyone knew one another and they were all so nice an had great conversations.  Wanted to try what the bartender called a Lunch Box  but the bartender was new and didn't remember how to make it.

Red robin is known for there hamburgers we ordered three at our table. One was perfect juicy medium rare the other two we had also ordered medium rare we burnt like hockey pucks covered with cheese I couldn't eat it.  Manager only comped one. Won't be returning!

I ordered a salad and it was $11 and I could have just made myself a salad at home chicken was dry the lady who took my order didn't know wht came on my salad and took 10 min to order my salad over the phone! Won't be goimg back for anything from this place very disappointed

I was so disappointed in the service we received tonight. We had to ask for napkins and forks.. 20 min later we finally got the napkins. As an adult I don't like sitting in a restaurant with food on my face. No one asked us for water refills or anything. Very disappointed.

I like Red Robin - I really do.  All you can eat fries that are actually pretty legit, good chain-restaurant quality burgers, and "mixologist" crafted drinks? It's the quintessential mall eatery. Like, if Waiting (the film with Ryan Reynolds) was an actual documentary, it would be based on Red Robin. (I think the movie pulls from Applebee's/TGIF.) So I come in and the hostess sits me down at a table and points out this device on the table. It's not an iPad...it's a contraption with a touch screen. And she says I can order my drinks and food and appetizers and desert through it, so okay, sure. I ordered through it, and this guy brings out my food. I pay with my credit card on the contraption (kiosky thing?), and it asks if I want to give a 25% tip. But wait - who am I tipping?  The device or the hostess or the guy who brought me my food/drinks? The gal and guy were pretty nice but they didn't really do anything that warranted a tip. I mean, I understand the sociopolitical implications of tipping, and I do tip - usually generously (20% on average). And then there's the new state-mandated law that basically affects the way tips are shared (e.g., cooks/chefs don't get a portion of tips). I won't launch in to a diatribe, so back to my original question: Who I am tipping? I can't logically justify at 25% tip when 90% of my interaction was with a kiosk/contraption/wanna-be iPad and not an employee.

Totally not the restaurants fault though. Red Robin come to the northwest!

Just came in for some drinks and a snack, but oh so glad we did. We have never had a bad experience. The food (burgers) are consistently great and the drinks have never watered down. Had the fish and chips today and while it's not like being at the beach, it was very good. Love that I can put seasoning salt on my fries and them dip them in tarter sauce. Yummy!

Never never would I have thought that a chain Mall location restaurant would be so great.  After several visits the food the service is truly great.  A must have is the tower of Onion Rings !! The best of the best.

Super dirty restaurant.  Greasy table food on lamp ceiling tiles have rust stains on them ... Our waiter was nice.  Manager didn't care we complained about cleanliness.   Just said they are getting a remodel in January !? What about now ...the greasy crappy stuff and food on lamps.   Gross.

I really want to give them ONE STAR.  I'm from LA, so we thought having Red Robin for a late lunch while in Bakersfield wouldn't be much different from the ones we usually go to. At first glance, you can see nearly all the servers are very young (even the janitorial staff). Different from what I'm used to, but I didn't want that to affect my experience. It was until we had to flag them down that I noticed how irritable it was. They had an excuse for EVERYTHING. "Oh, there's trash on this table. I'm sorry! Let me clean it before you sit. I can't believe no one did it beforehand." "No more ketchup? I just hate it when no one replaces it, don't you?" Look, I don't care if everything wasn't 1OO% prepared, so I don't need you trying to strike a conversation about how others aren't working. You weren't prepared, fine. But apologize for yourself and stop placing the blame elsewhere. I guess the servers are so young that they're so fixated on getting a gold star on every single thing they do. Anyways, food was good. (Although, my server had tried to question me on my order. I KNOW what kind of bread I want, so stop trying to get me to choose another bread!) Skimpy on the fries really, but not really a complaint when they're bottomless. Servers are always chatting in the grilling area, talking about their friends, lives, and jobs. Things you shouldn't be mentioning, let alone yelling about, while working. For the service alone, I will never come back. Thank GOD I live a hundred miles away.

Well won't be going there again anytime soon. Ordered the simple chicken sandwich with bottomless fries. Chicken sandwich was nasty. It tasted burnt. The way it was cooked tasted like the grill wasn't cleaned. It was charred and burnt tasting. I took only one bite, didn't even swallow it. The fries where stale. The waiter was nice.
I used to love this place but after talk with some from the mall this place has the biggest rat infestation next to target, discussing,

Everything was ok until we were treated like we wasn't a priority. It was my daughters birthday and I mentioned that to the waitress before we ordered. Instead of planning to have everyone sing when we were finishing our meal, we sat there and waited 10mins after everyone was done eating for them to sing. If my daughter didn't really want them to sing, we would have left especially since everyone else who had a birthday received their celebration at the appropriate time. Not a good experience

I came here with the bf and we both left with clogged arteries. We're both young so it's okay, but I would definitely not come here at age 30+ and with a slower metabolism. It's like a heart attack on a plate. I always get the same thing: Royal Red Robin burger. The great thing about ordering burgers here is that they have unlimited fries. Not the skinny fries you see at McDonald's. These babies are huge slices of potato, fried to perfection. We also ordered Freckled Lemonade, which you get unlimited refills of as well. I love fishing out the syrupy strawberry bits. Since I eat clean, healthy food 95% of the time, it feels good to indulge in greasy, unhealthy food once in a while. And Red Robin is perfect for that.

Went to visit my sister a few days after my birthday and got the awesome free birthday burger. Food and service where ok except for when I got sick later in the day... can't explain the sudden illness that hit me out of nowhere but once Red Robin was out of my system I was fine... Love the server well unless she poisoned me. I don't eat meat so if they cooked any part of my food on the meat grill (health code violation) then those douches almost killed me like the Seahawks did the Broncos.

To be honest ive had a better burger but the appetizer, fries, strawberry lemonade totally makes up for it. My waitress,  Briyette, made our experience even better! Convenient location and overall I had an amazing experience. Maybe next time ill go for a less safe burger!

I went for 6 other ladies for a lunch togetherness and was delighted with the Red robin waitress, RaShelle. She made this first time experience a great way to spend lunch, as she provided us with beverage refills as needed, answered questions that I had as to menu, and cleared table as needed.  Her pleasant personality means that we will be back, this time with my husband, and will be sure RaShelle is our waitress.  She was well worth a larger tip than necessary, and a good representative of Red Robin. the mushroom burger I ordered, less bun, was delicious as were the recommended garlic fries.   RaShelle also took the time to teach we older ladies how to use the new technology for our bills; good to meet a cordial employee for a change.
Pretty good. Burgers are great and fries are bottomless. Always be sure to use the seasoning on the fries, its so delicious!

Came here for lunch. Started at a bar booth and sat for 20mins without beig approached so I loved to a dining table and waited 30min for my food. Poor management/leadership. Love Red Robin but don't recommend this location.
Good food. Bottomless fries. Separate area that is adults only. Staff is usually friendly and food comes out quick.

The years I lived in Bako and ate here, I never had any issues with service or food. I think they have excellent waiters/waitresses and great food that is always deliciously prepared. After I ate at a Glendale one, I just had to write a good review to an actual good Red Robin. I will never again go to the Glendale location. If I ever visit Bako, I'll def be going to that one when I crave steak fries :)
I think they have 5 year olds running this place.  I feel bad for the servers.  Tell management to step it up, train the hosts and get better cooks.

So one thing I really love about Red Robin is the bar is a kid free zone! I live going after work or to watch a football game and not having to hear someone's screaming kids. We always getting treated awesome in the bar and the bartenders tend to know our faces when we come in. I love the whiskey river burger and the sands in your shorts drink. It's my favorite combo. We never get ignored and mistreated. Come to this Red Robin for a great burger and friendly faces!
Waitress persisted on flirting with my date for tips, fries were disgusting, drinks were never refilled and the orders were taken incorrectly. Not the best.

Red Robin is located inside the Valley Plaza Mall, near the Target.  They claim to have gourmet burgers.  I think their burgers are just okay.  The best thing on their menu, in my opinion, is their Cobb Salad.  I am not the type of guy to typically order a salad as a meal but their Cobb Salad with ranch is legit.  I also think their fish and chips are pretty good.  Their beer selection is decent and they make good girlie drinks too.  Although it is usually busy, we never wait too long for a table.  The place is looking a little dingy these days and could use a renovation.

My family and I met our out-of-town cousins here for dinner on a Tuesday night.  They accommodated our large group very well, sat us in a huge booth (all 9 of us, which included 4 small children), and there was no wait at all. Everyone was happy with their food, our waitress was wonderful, and they tried to keep the little ones happy by bringing them out fries to munch on right away, which I, as a mother,  greatly appreciated. They also brought the kids the usual menu with crayons, and also balloons. The only reason I didn't give a 5 star rating is because we made the mistake of using the electronic pay machine that they have at each table. We tried to split the bill evenly between three cards, which is an option, but not a user friendly one.  Long story short, no one in building could correct our double & incorrect charges that were already pending on our accounts, and we had to wait an extra 20 minutes while they unsuccessfully tried. All the incorrect pending charges did eventually disappear, but it was a huge inconvenience.

Sit at the bar to get good service. Anytime I sit in the dining area I get poor service. The bartender's are quick and know my order. This place is pretty cheap for how good their food is. I good burger and fries here is 10 bucks. I'm happy with that. The beer prices are good as well. Try and catch happy hour.
The food was great and my 20 month old had a blast with the children activities offered.
Very disappointed! No Octoberfest burger with pretzel bun. They discontinued it! Are you kidding me? The best reason to come here is gone. Maybe I'll come back next year and see if it's back.

I think the majority of people have tried Red Robin that are looking at reviews. This is just for this location. Down south we had better food service and quality. This location, however, we've had bad experiences. I would say it is expecting from these places. Tonight, like other nights, my burger was dry, sour because all you couls taste was the pickle with the relish. There was no balance. It was hard to even continue to eat it. Plus the waitress got my order wrong. They brought out appetizers too early, we asked and they confirmed they would come out with the main meal for my wife. However, they brought half of them right off the back. I definitely think paying $41 for mac-n-cheese, a burger, and 3 appetizers didn't hit the spot. Our waitress seemed snobby too, not just to us but to her other tables. I also was shocked to be given 30 minute wait times and yet lots of open tables and booths and it seemed like good coverage too. I've seen it more full with less staff. It probably will be my last time for a long while. Nothing worth coming back for.

First of all... I love the food but I'm noticing the last year or so this restaurant has gone downhill when it comes to cleanliness. I refuse to go there anymore due to the caked on food all around the booths! If the booths look this way... how does their kitchen look? I probably don't want to know!!! Come on Red Robin, give the restaurant a deep cleaning so I can return for your awesome food!!!

We have been going to the Red Robin on Ming Ave since it opened. The food has been great. However, in the past year, it has become unkept and dirty. The blinds in the bar area are disgusting! The tabletops are scared and in need of refinishing. Is the kitchen as dirty as the blinds?

We've been going here for years off and on.  We moved back to Bakersfield a week ago and decided to visit one of our faves...still love it!  The service we got was exceptional and our waitress Rochelle, was wonderful!  We didn't have to ask for anything.  We were seated quickly, food was great, no complaints at all.  Great place to take the kids, too!  Plus for a family of five, our check only came to 47 bucks...endless fries, endless drinks!  Remains one of our favorites! :)

The kids love it, and the shake servings are quite generous. The people who had burgers enjoyed them. I had the grilled chicken with fresh melon instead of fries, it sucked. I had to douse it in ketchup because the chicken was so dry, and the melon was under ripe. The tomatoes were mealy. My lunch was gross. But everybody who didn't eat healthy had a much better meal, so if you eat burgers and fries, it's fine. If you eat healthy, don't bother.

I'm usually not one to give 5 stars to a chain restaurant, but golly geeze, my experience at this particular Red Robin on Friday night has put them ahead of their bay area counterparts. I've been dining at Red Robin's in the bay area for years and years, but this one blew me away in terms of service and food.  First, we were greeted by a friendly hostess and despite a crowded waiting room (and restaurant), we were seated within 5 minutes, may be even 3.  We didn't wait long at all when our server acknowledged us. Her name was Isis and she even apologized for the wait. We were thinking "What wait?"  She was spot on the whole time.  Attentive and friendly and not at all invasive.  I ordered some chicken pesto aioli sandwich with garlic parmasan fries. YUMMY. Chicken breast was cooked perfect, not  dry at all.  In fact, I polished my plate. My db ordered the turkey burger, he too polished his plate. Also, had no idea the endless basket of fries applied to the garlic parmesan ones!  When Isis gave us the choice, we were stumped because last we ate at the Saratoga Red Robin, they only gave us regular fries even though I ordered a plate that offered the garlic parmesan ones.   Glad we decided to eat there for our first meal in Bakersfield.  :)

So treated my daughter to Red Robin for lunch.  Checked in and we were told it would be 15min wait, so since it is located in the mall we walked around nearby until called.  But as we were walking away, I noticed that there was many tables unoccupied.  Thought, hmmm wonder why there are so many people in the lobby waiting with these empty tables available.  First thought is, are they that unorganized?  Or is it the kind of place that likes to have people waiting to show the across the way restaurant that they are more busy then they are..marketing ploy or something...who knows.  Regardless, hate when I see open table and many people waiting in the lobby.  But that is not why I am writing this review.  I am writing it because I dont always go to Red Robin as it is not easy to find parking being located in the mall and always seems to be very busy, but my daughter loves this place and I treated her because she got on the Principal's List this quarter.  Took a few mins for waitress to greet us and when she did, she was more concerned with this black screen item which I guess they call a "Kiosk" on our table as she noticed it was out of paper.  I had no idea what this thing was as I did not want to touch it because it appeared to have lots of fingerprints not clean looking.  At first thought, it seemed to be a new thing they put on the tables to entertain kids because I saw it had games/apps you can download and a "bank card swiper" because of course it was not free to play those games.  So the waitress said if we wanted to order an appetizer we can do it on that kiosk, I said no thank you ...no appetizers for us.  After she walked away, I put it away from us up on top of the window seal cuz it just looked unsanitary.  Our food came, it was good, no issues there.  Waited again for waitress to reappear, after 20 mins had to waiver her down because I needed our check.  She pointed to the "kiosk" thing and said....you do it on there....I had no idea what she was implying and felt very confused on what she was suggesting.  So she grabbed it and said, See you can do your own check out right on this kiosk.  I was very surprised to hear that, and asked her...Did you mention that before because I dont remember you saying anything about it, she said yes I did when I told you that you can order your appetizer on here.  I said, interesting because I did not hear you say anything like that.  So I proceeded to have to use the germ infested kiosk to check out.  This review is just to let others know, in the case you dont know how to read minds like my waitress expected me to do, that they no longer bring you your check in a little black bi-fold.....perhaps you should bring your stylus so you dont have to touch that nasty thing that clearly does not get cleaned on a regular basis......Germ-A-Fobs....this is not the place for you :(

I was down in Bakersfield recently for a couple of days.  My brother-in-law suggested getting a quick bite here.  I'd never eaten at a Red Robin before, but figured I could find something.  I have a lot of food allergies/intolerances, the major one being gluten.  My brother-in-law made a comment to our server about me needing gluten free.  She brought me a gluten free menu (which came with a nice legal disclaimer and which is pretty standard where gluten free is concerned) and also said that they had gluten free buns.  Usually gluten free buns are a bit dry and hard, but these were delicious!  I don't know if all Red Robins have them though. We were seated quickly, but did have to wait for our food for a while.  Our server was attentive throughout...I wish I had gotten her name now that I think of it, because she was excellent and very helpful.

I got burnt the last two times I went to this place. Fool me once shame on you; fool me twice..... well you know how goes. Their burgers are not gourmet, unless the standard for being gourmet has greatly gone down. You could do better at Juicy Burger. Needless to say, I will not be going back.
Went for lunch and can't say I had any complaint. Service was pleasent and prompt, food above expectations for a chain restaurant, great choices, beer served very cold. Kudoos!
Had a Bleu Cheese Burger & Strawberry Lemonade.  This location was inside a shopping mall.  It was very noisy.  The servers were not as attentive as in other non-mall environment restaurants.

This is an awesome place. I don't like the idea that my kids cant sit in the bar area anymore, but i guess whatever. Good food and you get what you want. Good service and they all help each other out when in need.

Let me just say horrible service!! Wont be coming back for a while. My bf and i were greeted by a nice hostess katilyn, who lead us to our seats. We eagerly looked over the menu. Thus is when the disappoint started it took the waitress at least if not more five minutes to come to our table. She did not apologize for the wait and she didn't greet us with her name. She proceeded to ask if we looked over the menu and what would we like. Irritated I asked for water and peach tea as my bf asked for lemonade. We also placed an appetizer order. She dropped off our drinks and didn't return for another ten to 15 minutes to get our entree order. After waiting for what seemed like forever our food arrived. The food was just OK nothing special ( we got the red royal robin). I do have to say the server did improve on refilling our drinks on a timely manner. We did not find out the servers name until the bill came.. Natalie! My bf is a manager at a restaurant and I am a server. When we go out we except great service because that is what we provide not to mention we are a paying customer service should be already good. If red robin wants to improve the managers nd servers shouldn't hide behind the fact it was a lunch rush. Even if the restaurant is full/busy the customers deserve good service. Train your servers on greet times and proper greetings. Also teach them how to check up on the status of the table. These would be my recommendations for the restaurant!!

I've been in here multiple times but recently have been coming in later at night for a quick dinner, not sure if the waiters just want to leave or not but, the food always comes out quick. Service is slow on refills and checking on the table though.
We go here often. The foods pretty good but seems a bit over priced. Maybe because its at the mall.

Located within Valley Plaza mall, this little pit stop is just that... a pit stop.  It tries, but just doesn't quite have the charm of a 50s diner but isn't dirty enough to be a truck stop. The food is garbage American.  It's not Carls Jr, but in some ways it may as well be.  While the portioning isn't terrible and the shakes and malts are a plus, it doesn't make up for the quality of said establishment and the service I got the last time I came here with an adult friend of mine to catch up. Red Robin would be so much better if the food, service, and cleanliness matched their decor.  It's trying hard but it doesn't feel like you're trying at all oh diner place. For shame.

I used to love this place, especially for their Banzai Burgers, but the last couple times I've gone, the quality has really slipped, especially in the size of the burgers. They managed to cook my burger in such a way that it was both undercooked and dry at the same time - unimpressive. Fries were lukewarm and overcooked. Save yourself 50% and hit up In & Out for a better burger experience (sadly).

This is my first negative review, but then again, this is only my third review.  Am I prolific or what?! The food here is pretty good.  I have no complaints about it, but all three times I've been here the service has been abysmal!! Empty glasses everywhere, empty "bottomless" fries and waiting forever to get your tab in the end.    The service has to be horrible for me to leave less than an 15% tip, and I left a 5% at this last visit.  Not good.  The only reason it gets two stars was because the food was decent.
service can be slow when you walk in but i love their burgers and fries
Food was hot, drink was cold and the service was great.

This particular Red Robin is located inside Valley Plaza Mall.  When we first got there the waiting line was somewhat long.  It took us about 10 minutes to get a seat.  After we were seated i noticed that the table was half cleaned with no kind of utensils to eat with.  As i sat down i notice that my shoes were smashing french fries that have been left under the table from the previous customers.  Anyway we ordered our drinks, entree and food(after 10 minutes of sitting there) only to be served out main dish first.  As i stated before, we had no silverware so i had to stop a worker to get a fork so that my wife can eat her salad.  After eating the main dish and getting ready to leave they finally decided to bring out our entree order.  Yeah....30 minutes later.  I told the guy just to box it up so we can leave.  I guess he felt bad cause we recieved it late.  He ended up giving it to us for free.  Anyway this was my first and last time eating there.  I don't recommend this place to anyone!

Right off I knocked a star from the rating just because of their location - a mall.  I don't like going to the Valley Plaza mall. It's unsafe, there are too many people, etc.  But I go there for Red Robin.  The other star was taken off for the service I received. I sat down with no napkins or utensils at my table.  I ordered the riblets, so I think I would need some napkins.  My party received our food quickly, so fast that we didn't have our drinks yet.  They were specialty drinks, but still, drinks should come with the food at least. The food was great though.  Red Robin always has good food going for it at the right price.  So that is always a bonus when I go.  I have no complaints about that. Now the bill came and was $10 more than expected.  I ordered a root beer float for my drink and my friend ordered some purple non-alcoholic drink.  My root beer float was advertised as bottomless, and my friends drink was on the same page as the other bottomless drinks.  However, we were charged each time we received a refill.  The worst part is that the waiter didn't even know the specialty drink my friend ordered!  We disputed the bill and they said my root beer float was bottomless, but the other drink was not.  When we were leaving we checked the menu, and sure enough, it was on the same page as the other drinks that were bottomless.  So they lost a star for that. My recommendation is that you thoroughly check your bill before you pay.  However, the food is decent enough to deal with that headache.
Kim and amyee are awesome bartender, by far the best experience I've had at Red Robin. ....yuuum

My boyfriend loves coming to Red Robin because it's convenient while shopping in the mall or Target. We recently went during lunch time and boy, our service was bad.  We waited about 10 minutes for a table and our server quickly appeared to take our drink orders, but we didn't see her much after that. I wanted to order an appetizer and tried to use the ziosk things they have on the table but ours wasn't working. We got another waitress to get ours and she said she would reset it and to try it 2 minutes so that we could order. We waited, & tried but still nothing worked. She finally got our appetizer order in after hitting the "call server" button twice and then left without taking our food order. A food runner brought our appetizer and then she finally came to take our order but didn't realize that both of us needed refills. It took awhile to get those and after most of the crowd left she said "finally, I can stop running around." Service was just a miss.  Maybe it was just the lunch rush because I'm not used to coming here and getting that, but the food wasn't great either. I'll take a break from coming here.

Me and my family decided to go to Red Robin for dinner since we were at the mall and we heard there was a deal for veterans. Both of my parents are veterans so when we ordered our food at 6:00-6:10 my parents got the free burgers. The waitress was rude as soon as she heard they were veterans and we sat waiting for our food for over an hour and left after we realized people who were sitting down a while after us were getting their food. I hardly ever go to Red Robin because of the distance but it was one of my favorite places to go but I don't see that happening anytime soon if that is how they treat veterans of this country. My brother was so bored that he noticed we were sitting at "table 16." I don't remember the waitresses name or even what she looked like after being there for so long. The lady at the door was very nice after my mom told her what had happened but the service in the corner of the restaurant was terrible, they never even came back to refill our drinks.

Pros decent food. Nice environment  Kid friendly Cons. It took 5 minutes for a host to take my name for a table Our waitress while nice was working too many table to effectively serve them all. Not here fault, poor management here No refills on drinks the whole visit.  My biggest pet peeve with this visit.  The pay at your table kiosk.  How tacky, if I am paying extra for a restaurant table service it needs to be complete. I'm not a fan of paying to do your job.  Will I eat here again. Nope

Maybe it was a bad day but the service was really bad!!!! The drinks (margarita) was all ice. when I ordered another drink I asked please may I have less ice and the excuse was sorry there's a new bartender... And my new drink had even more ice!!!! The waitress don't get me wrong was very nice but she was so overwhelmed that it seemed like she was the only one working (Erica).  Last time I go to red Robin I'm not happy at all.

I go here at least once a month usually on payday after work. The food is great and honestly the service here is excellent, i'd dare to say the people who serve the bar side are the most welcoming and friendly people I've ever received service from.

My burger was cold, so I requested that they warm it up. Instead they brought me another one that was also cold. I didn't bother sending it back again. To make matters worse, they charged me for the second burger, which I didn't order. So I had to request that they remove the charge.  The only good thing about lunch was Blue moon draft beer. I'll think twice before dinning over here again. It's a shame, since in the past I had many good dinning experiences here, but something has changed.

This is an updated review of Red Robin. First let me start with the management. They are on the ball people! I was contacted less than 24 hours after my last review on yelp. The first initial contact was from out of town perhaps corporate and was through a message on Yelp. My second contact was a personal phone call from a local manager. I was given a heartfelt apology and a gift card to comeback and try them again.  I returned gift card in tow and am happy to say that I was much more satisfied with the quality ( temperature) of my food. My waitress was very nice and helped me sign up for the rewards program they offer ( very cool) which gave me a free hamburger of my choice during my birthday month! My only major complaint is that every visit it's seems to be a chore to get refills on drinks or sides of sauces once I receive my meal. Maybe understaffed? I have also noticed many times other people (staff, runners, managers) bringing food to tables.  All in all I love Red Robin. I can eat bottomless fries, feed my picky kids and people watch all the crazies in the mall.

Food was great! Compliments to the cook! But the hosting and waiting stuff for horrible. First as I walked into the restaurant I stood patiently waiting for the hostess to acknowledge me. Her name was Amber. After about a minute or so I asked her if I could be seated. She looked as if I interrupted her from a deep thought and said "You can sit anywhere you like.", and smiled. So I did seat myself strangely at a booth near the end. A male waiter presented himself and asked the basics. Told me his name was Matt and took my order and left. As I looked around there were groups of team members talking by the kitchen entrance. They were laughing and joking around, then I noticed my waiter Matt was apart of the group. After 6 or so minutes he finally brought my beverage.  Those were my only concerns. Staffing needs to be rethought.
TERRIBLE service, overpriced food that's less than mediocre in flavor and greasy tables/menus. AVOID.

Will Go Back!!!!  Husband and I went for dinner on a Monday night. Was busy but got table right away. Our waiter was super friendly and attentive filling up drinks and checking on us. I ordered some sort of whisky BBQ burger with crispy onions on it. Husband ordered fish and chips.  While waiting for order I was looking at the tablet on table and saw they have bottomless root beer floats! Husband said next time he will get one instead of the strawberry lemonade with real strawberries in it. (That means there is a next time!)  Our order came quickly even though the place was busy. My burger was so big I had to cut it first and after first half was done I could only eat part of the inside with a fork ( ate all the crispy onions they were yummy!) I usually don't care for fish, but the fish and chips my husband ordered looked so good, I might just order it next time. Not only were they nice and golden, they looked tender and flaky! And they were big pieces.    The bottomless steak fries that came with both our dinners were OK. They could have been a tad hotter but really not complaining. Waiter came by and asked if we wanted more. But I was full from that burger.   We didn't order dessert, but they show a brownie sticks covered in chocolate and served with berry dipping sauce on the tablet at the table. If I wasn't already full I'd have gotten it to share with hubby as it looked good. I don't mind the location being at the mall. It just means easier access to shopping! Which is what we did after.

My mother recently left her wallet behind at this location. She in a panic reached out to the store and found out that the manager had her wallet locked up in the safe. Having driven 4 hrs up the road to San Jose they were not anywhere close to return to pick up the wallet. My parents offered to pay for the shipping but the manager said that it would taken care of. Hats off to this location for putting my parents minds at ease!!!!

Why do I keep coming coming back here??  Every time I come the service is horrible, my waiter skipped my table and asked the table in front of us and the two beside us, if they were doing fine. I didn't know we were painted on the wall. Also my drinks didn't get here until my food did, they were watered down, and my appetizer never showed up. If the food wasn't so good I would have stopped coming here a long time ago, definitely going to find a new place  for a good burger!

We are always pleasantly surprised when we visit. We dont expect much when dining at a mall, but service is great, food is good, and prices are reasonable. And this one has improved by enclosing the walls so mall traffic isnt so distracting.  Endless fries and cheesey mac, a new menu, improved appetizers, homemade dipping sauces, options for everyone, and a new Mint Brownie Shake. How can you go wrong???
Bad bad service, waiter couldn't handle more than one table, waited for ever for tea even longer for food....always great service with Candace, will request her from now on....

We've been going to this Red Robin since spring 2011 and it's slowly going down hill... Today waiting longer than 10 mins just for water and ice tea. Few weeks ago nearly empty restaurant and took 35 mins to get our food and being it was my bday waitress came out and basically tossed a cup of ice cream on table and said happy birthday.

Although this place is known for burgers; I enjoy their shot ribs. they also have some fancy looking colorful drinks Place is inside valley plaza mall. So close to the office; I go there just for the ribs.

The five stars is for our bartender Kim! It was her first day back after maternity leave and she was the bomb! Poor girl had an amazing attitude, even after only a couple hours sleep with a newborn! She was attentive,  personable and it was obvious that the regulars were glad she was back too! I don't usually frequent the mall, but had a few hours to kill while my phone was at the Apple Store. I would definitely return knowing Kim would be our girl.

I went to a RR in Dallas for the first time in ages. There I had the most amazing BBQ chicken wrap. It tasted so good that while we were driving home from LA and got hungry I decided that we just had to stop by and get another. It was that good.  I called in the order while we were a few miles out and when we got there just as it was finished. The girls at the counter we very nice and helpful. When we got back into the car and I started tearing down I was really very sad. It still tasted the same but didn't at the same time. The big difference was that the veggies in this wrap were somehow soggy, where as the last time I had it they were fresh and crunchy. I was also missing the coleslaw that it came with. Something I really didn't want to find out as we were driving home which was nearly 2 hours away. I didn't want to have to turn around for my order to be right, so I dealt with it. It was so soggy I only ate half.
